Solarillion Foundation

Solarillion Foundation is a not-for-profit research, outreach and education organization working with research institutions, government agencies and organizations to carry out research on policy, technology and related areas in the field of Machine Learning, Internet of Things, Embedded Systems, renewable energy, and sustainable engineering.

Established in 2012, Solarillion encourages and mentors highly motivated under-graduate/graduate students, young professionals interested in research in the emerging areas of renewable energy and sustainable engineering. These students will ideally continue to pursue higher education in established institutions and follow a career path in engineering research and innovation.

News

  • 18 January 2018

    Congratulations to James for winning a 2018 Facebook Fellowship!

  • 16 January 2018

    Liang, Tianqi, Thierry, Eddie, and Haichen had their Parameter Hub and TVM papers accepted to SysML! Nice job guys!

    Ming and Liang had their ASPLOS 2017 paper on in-network computing selected for Micro Top Picks.

  • 16 November 2017

    Two of our projects won runner up for the Madrona Prize! Congrats to Amrita, Armin, Luis, and Mark for their work on real-time virtual reality video hardware, and to Thierry and Luis (and our friends in machine learning) for their work on the TVM end-to-end deep learning stack.

Research Themes

ACCEPT

An approximate compiler for C and C++ program based on Clang.

  • asampson

Approximate Computing

Cross-stack techniques and frameworks to safely trade-off accuracy in computation, storage and communication for better performance and energy efficiency.

  • asampson
  • moreau

Biological Computing

Working at the intersection of biology and architecture, including biologically-inspired computer systems like DNA storage, and system design for next-generation bioinformatics applications.

  • kendall
  • mwillsey

Software Defined Hardware

Programming language techniques for automatically designing custom reconfigurable accelerators.

  • vlee2
  • mwillsey
  • armin

ShoeBox

Efficiently supporting multi-quality image storage

  • eqy

SNNAP

Off-the-shelf hardware acceleration for neural networks in the context of approximate computing.

  • moreau
  • wysem
  • nelson
  • asampson

Stochastic Computing

Stochastic circuits and computing applications for low power accelerator and sensor applications.

  • vlee2
  • armin

Real-time Virtual Reality Video

Camera rigs and custom hardware for next-generation VR/AR applications.

  • amrita
  • armin

Funding

Our work is supported by the National Science Foundation, the state of Washington, the C-FAR Center for Future Architectures, DARPA, and generous gifts from Microsoft, Intel, Google, Qualcomm and NetApp.
